cyclone.name: NICHOLAS
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles SSE of the mouth of the Rio Grande
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest across the western Gulf, then slowing and turning north to northeast toward the central Texas coast before bending across eastern Texas and into Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Texas coast (roughly Matagorda Bay to Galveston area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Port Aransas to High Island, Texas (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Rio Grande to Port Aransas, Texas (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northeastern Mexico, south-central Texas coast, and western to central Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39-46 mph) are possible but probabilities remain low (17% cumulative).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible (<3 ft) mainly west of the port; significant inundation not expected at Lake Charles.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5-10 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause flash and urban flooding in the Lake Charles area beginning late Monday night through Wednesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential river/low-land flooding and reduced visibility; prolonged rainfall may impact cargo handling and ground transportation links.
